intro: Haplostylis barbata, commonly known as the barbed beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Haplostylis barbata thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
